sentences.sentence: “The first thing put us out was that advertisement.
Spaulding came into the office eight weeks ago, with this paper in hand, and he says:
‘I wish, Mr( 先生 ). Wilson, that I was a red-headed man.’
‘Why?’ I ask.
‘Well,’ says he, ‘here’s another place( 职位 ) open with the League of the Red-headed Men.
It’s worth a lot of money to any man who gets it, and I understand that there are more places than there are men.
If my hair would only change colour, here’s a nice little job all ready for me to step into.’
‘What is it, then?’ I asked.
You see. Mr( 先生 ). Holmes, I am a very stay-at-home man,
and as my business comes to me instead of my having to go to it, I often don’t go outside for weeks.
So I did not know much of what was going on outside, and I was always glad of a bit of news.
‘Have you never heard of the League of the Red-headed Men?’ he asked.
‘Never.’
‘Well, I am surprised, since I think you could easily get a place with them.’
‘And what would a place be worth?’ I asked.
‘Oh, only a couple of hundred pounds a year, but the work is slight, and it need not interfere( 妨碍 ) very much with one’s other business.’
Well, that made me think, for the business has not been very good for some years,
and an extra couple of hundred pounds would have been very useful.
‘Tell me all about it,’ said I.
‘Well,’ said he, showing me the advertisement,
‘you can see for yourself that the League has a place open, and there is the address where you should apply for details.
As far as I understand, the League was started by a rich American, Ezekiah Hopkins, who was very peculiar( 怪异的，奇怪的 ) in his ways.
He was himself red-headed, and he had a great sympathy for all red-headed men.
When he died it was found that he had left his enormous fortune to be used to give easy work to men whose hair is of that color.
From all I hear it is splendid pay and very little to do.’
‘But,’ said I, ‘there would be millions of red-headed men who would apply.’
‘Not so many as you might think,’ he answered.
‘You see it is really limited to Londoners, and to grown men.
This American started his business in London when he was young, and he wanted to help the old town.
Then, again, I have heard it is no use applying if your hair is light red, or dark red, or anything except real bright, blazing( 炽烈的 ), fiery( 火一般的 ) red.
Now, if you cared to( 想做，愿意做 ) apply, Mr( 先生 ). Wilson, I am sure you would get in.
But perhaps it would hardly be worth the effort for just a few hundred pounds.’
Now, as you can see, my hair is of a very full and rich color,
so it seemed to me that I stood as good a chance( 有成功的机会 ) as any other man.
Vincent Spaulding seemed to know so much about it that I thought he might prove useful,
so I ordered him to close for the day and to come with me.
So we shut the business up( 关闭商铺，停业 ) and started off for the address that was given us in the advertisement.
I will never see such a sight as that again, Mr( 先生 ). Holmes.
From north, south, east, and west every man who had a shade of red in his hair had come into the city to answer the advertisement.
Fleet Street was completely full of red-headed people, and Pope’s Court looked like a cart( 运货马车 ) full of oranges.
I should not have thought there were as many people in the whole country as the people brought together by that single advertisement.
Every shade of color was there—straw, lemon, orange, brick, raw meat( 生肉色 );
but, as Spaulding said, there were not many who had the real bright flame color.
When I saw how many were waiting, I would have given this up in despair;
but Spaulding would not hear of it.
How he did it I could not imagine,
but he pushed and pulled and shoved( 挤 ) until he got me through the crowd, and right up to the steps which led to the office.
Some were going up in hope, and some coming back disappointed;
but we did our best to move ahead and soon found ourselves in the office.”
There was nothing in the office but a couple of wooden chairs and a table, behind which sat a small man with hair even redder than mine.
He said a few words to each candidate as he came up,
and then he always managed to find some fault in each of them.
Getting a place did not seem to be such a very easy matter, after all.
However, when our turn came the little man was much more favorable to me than to any of the others,
and he closed the door as we entered, so that he might have a private word with us.
‘This is Mr( 先生 ). Jabez Wilson,’ said my assistant, ‘and he is willing to fill a place in the League.’
‘And he is very well suited for it,’ the other answered.
‘He has every requirement. I have seen never anything so fine.’
He took a step back and looked at my hair until I felt quite shy.
Then suddenly he stepped forward, shook my hand( 握手 ), and congratulated me warmly on my success.
‘I am sorry,’ said he, ‘please excuse me for taking an obvious precaution( 预防，防备 ).’
With that he seized my hair in both his hands, and pulled until I screamed with the pain.
‘There is water in your eyes,’ he said as he let me go.
‘I can see that all is as it should be.
But we have to be careful, for we have twice been deceived( 欺骗 ) by wigs( 假发 ) and once by paint.’
He stepped over to the window and shouted through it at the top of his voice that the place was filled.
A groan( 叹息声 ) of disappointment came up from below,
and everyone went away in different directions until there was not a red head to be seen except my own and that of the manager.
‘My name,’ said he, ‘is Mr( 先生 ). Duncan Ross, and I myself receive an income from this fund( 基金 ).
Are you a married man, Mr( 先生 ). Wilson? Have you a family?’
I answered that I had not.
His face fell immediately.
‘Dear me!’ he said, ‘that is very serious indeed! I am sorry to hear you say that.
The fund( 基金 ) was, of course, for the spread of red-heads as well as for their maintenance( 生活费用 ).
It is most unfortunate that you should be a bachelor.’
My face lengthened at this, Mr( 先生 ). Holmes, for I thought that I was not to have the place after all;
but after thinking it over for a few minutes he said that it would be all right.
‘In the case of another,’ said he, ‘the objection might be fatal( 避免不了的 ),
but we must stretch a point( 破例，通融 ) in favor of a man with such a head of hair as yours.
When will you be able to start your new duties?’
‘Well, it is a little difficult, for I have a business already,’ said I.
‘Oh, never mind about that, Mr( 先生 ). Wilson!’ said Vincent Spaulding.
‘I should be able to look after that for you.’
‘What would be the hours?’ I asked.
‘Ten to two.’
Now a pawnbroker’s business is mostly done in the evening, Mr( 先生 ). Holmes, especially Thursday and Friday evenings, which are just before pay-day.
It would suit me very well to earn a little in the mornings.
Besides, I knew that my assistant was a good man, and that he would take care of any business issues.
‘That would suit me very well,’ said I. ‘And the pay?’
‘Is four pounds a week.’
‘And the work?’
‘Is very easy.’
‘What do you call very easy?’
‘Well, you have to be in the office, or at least in the building, the whole time.
If you leave, you lose your place forever. The will is very clear upon that point.’
‘It’s only four hours a day, and I should not think of leaving,’ said I.
‘No excuses accepted,’ said Mr( 先生 ). Duncan Ross, ‘neither sickness nor business nor anything else.
There you must stay, or you lose your place.’
‘And the work?’
‘Is to copy out the Encyclopedia Britannica( 大英百科全书 ).
There is the first volume( 一卷 ) of it on the table.
You must find your own ink, pens, and blotting-paper, but we provide this table and chair.
Will you be ready tomorrow?’
‘Certainly,’ I answered.
‘Then, good-bye, Mr( 先生 ). Jabez Wilson,
and let me congratulate you once more on the important position which you have been lucky enough to gain.’
He bowed to me and wished me goodbye,
and I went home with my assistant, hardly knowing what to say or do.”

article_info.previous: Waston去拜访Sherlock Holmes时遇到一位红发客人Mr. Wilson，Sherlock根据Mr. Wilson的外表推断出他的社会身份和过去经历，Mr. Wilson带来的广告登着关于红发会的招人启事，这貌似是一件非常独特而有意思的案件。
article_info.share_words: From north, south, east, and west every man who had a shade of red in his hair had come into the city to answer the advertisement. Fleet Street was completely full of red-headed people, and Pope’s Court looked like a cart full of oranges.

question.cn: 谁给Mr. Wilson看了关于红发会的广告?
question.en: Who showed Mr. Wilson the advertisement about The Red-Headed League?

analysis: 文中提到“The first thing put us out was that advertisement. Spaulding came into the office eight weeks ago, with this paper in his hand.”所以选B。

question.cn: 为什么那个美国人要把财产留给红头发的人?
question.en: Why did the American leave the fortune to red-headed men?

options.cn: 因为他自己就是红头发，并且对所有红发人怀有同情心。
options.en: He was himself red-headed and had a sympathy for all red-headed men.

options.cn: 因为相较于其他人，大多数红发人找工作都很困难。
options.en: Most red-headed men had more difficulty finding jobs than others.

options.cn: 因为他妻子也是红头发。

analysis: 文中提到“He was himself red-headed, and he had a great sympathy for all red-headed men.”后面紧接着说那个美国人把财产都留给了红头发的人，所以选A。

question.cn: 都有谁前去应聘那份广告？
question.en: Who came to answer the advertisement?

options.cn: 只有Mr. Wilson和另一个红发男子。
options.en: Only Mr. Wilson and another red-headed man.

analysis: 文中提到“From north, south, east, and west every man who had a shade of red in his hair had come into the city to answer the advertisement. Fleet Street was completely full of red-headed people, and Pope’s Court looked like a cart full of oranges.”所以选A。

question.cn: 什么能成为离开职位的理由?
question.en: What excuse could be accepted for a leaving?

analysis: 文中提到“‘No excuses accepted,’ said Mr. Duncan Ross, ‘neither sickness nor business nor anything else.’”所以选C。

question.cn: 办公室里的工作是什么?
question.en: What was the work in the office?

options.en: To copy out the Encyclopedia Britannica.

analysis: 文中提到“‘And the work?’ ‘Is to copy out the Encyclopedia Britannica. There is the first volume of it on the table.’”所以选B。
